segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and we're going to a family party today, right, Marco?
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要去一个家庭聚会，对吧，Marco？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We're going to go see our family, our relatives, and we're going to talk about all the different family members that you can have.
segments.cn: 我们要去见我们的家人、亲戚，讨论一下你可以拥有的各种家庭成员。

segments.en: So there's some very, very specific family members that sometimes you don't really know the names of.
segments.cn: 有一些非常具体的家庭成员，有时你可能不知道他们的名字。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we're not talking about mother, father, brother, sister.
segments.cn: 我们不是在谈论母亲、父亲、兄弟、姐妹。

segments.en: We're talking about what we call in English extended family.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论我们在英语中称之为扩展家庭的东西。

segments.en: So that means not just the people you live with but also people you're related to, who are maybe in different parts of your family.
segments.cn: 这意味着不仅是和你住在一起的人，还有与你有血缘关系的人，可能在你家庭的不同部分。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue, and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 那么让我们听听对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: What are you doing this weekend?
segments.cn: 你这个周末在做什么？

segments.en: My brother-in-law is having a small get-together at his house and he invited me.
segments.cn: 我姐夫在他家举办一个小聚会，他邀请了我。

segments.en: Is it a family thing or just friends?
segments.cn: 是家庭聚会还是朋友聚会？

segments.en: A bit of both.
segments.cn: 两者都有。

segments.en: Some cousins, aunts, and uncles will be there, but also some friends from the neighborhood.
segments.cn: 会有一些表亲、姑姑和叔叔，但也会有一些邻居的朋友。

segments.en: Is your great-uncle Rick going to be there?
segments.cn: 你的外曾叔Rick会来吗？

segments.en: He is really funny.
segments.cn: 他真的很有趣。

segments.en: Yeah, he's going to be there with his stepson and his ex-wife.
segments.cn: 是的，他会和他的继子以及前妻一起到场。

segments.en: You mean your sister?
segments.cn: 你是说你的姐姐吗？

segments.en: No, Rick is actually my great-uncle, so he's my grandmother's brother.
segments.cn: 不，Rick实际上是我的外曾叔，他是我祖母的兄弟。

segments.en: You lost me.
segments.cn: 我听不懂了。

segments.en: I'll explain later.
segments.cn: 我稍后再解释。

segments.en: Let's go.
segments.cn: 我们走吧。

segments.en: Alright, so now let's talk about these family members on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们在Language Takeaway中谈谈这些家庭成员。

segments.en: Language Takeaway So, Marco, we've got four family members to talk about today.
segments.cn: Language Takeaway 所以，Marco，今天我们要谈论四个家庭成员。

segments.en: And the first one is brother-in-law.
segments.cn: 第一个是姐夫。

segments.en: Right, so we have the word brother-in-law.
segments.cn: 对，所以我们有姐夫这个词。

segments.en: So basically this person is married to your sister.
segments.cn: 基本上，这个人是你姐姐的丈夫。

segments.en: That's right, so I have a brother, I have a sister, but when these people marry, they marry someone who I'm not related to by blood.
segments.cn: 没错，我有一个兄弟，我有一个姐妹，但当这些人结婚时，他们会嫁给我没有血缘关系的人。

segments.en: We call them in-laws, so brother-in-law, sister-in-law.
segments.cn: 我们称他们为姻亲，所以姐夫、嫂子。

segments.en: Right, so that's exactly it.
segments.cn: 对，这正是如此。

segments.en: The key there is that when it has the ending in-law, it means that you're not related to them by blood.
segments.cn: 关键在于，当它以-in-law结尾时，意味着你与他们没有血缘关系。

segments.en: It's your extended family because of marriage.
segments.cn: 这是因为婚姻而形成的扩展家庭。

segments.en: That's right, so I have a younger brother.
segments.cn: 没错，所以我有一个弟弟。

segments.en: When he gets married, I will have a sister-in-law.
segments.cn: 当他结婚时，我将有一个嫂子。

segments.en: That's right, and it applies to, for example, father-in-law.
segments.cn: 没错，这也适用于，例如，岳父。

segments.en: That would be your husband's dad or mother-in-law would be your husband's mother.
segments.cn: 那是你丈夫的父亲，或岳母是你丈夫的母亲。

segments.en: Yeah, so these are all related to you by marriage.
segments.cn: 是的，这些都是通过婚姻与你相关的。

segments.en: Alright, so now moving on to the next type of extended family member that we have is a stepson.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们要谈论的下一个扩展家庭成员是继子。

segments.en: Your uncle has a stepson.
segments.cn: 你的叔叔有一个继子。

segments.en: So a stepson.
segments.cn: 所以继子。

segments.en: Now this can get very confusing.
segments.cn: 这可能会变得非常混乱。

segments.en: Let's take a simple, simple family.
segments.cn: 让我们以一个简单的家庭为例。

segments.en: We have two people and they're married, but they get divorced.
segments.cn: 我们有两个人，他们结婚，但后来离婚。

segments.en: So they split up.
segments.cn: 所以他们分开了。

segments.en: And now maybe they had some kids, the wife has kids, and she gets married to someone else.
segments.cn: 现在也许他们有一些孩子，妻子有孩子，她嫁给了其他人。

segments.en: So her new husband calls her son his stepson.
segments.cn: 所以她的新丈夫称她的儿子为继子。

segments.en: Because it's not his son, it's another man's son.
segments.cn: 因为这不是他的儿子，而是另一个男人的儿子。

segments.en: But they're still related by marriage.
segments.cn: 但他们仍然通过婚姻相关。

segments.en: So when your new husband or your new wife has kids from another marriage, they're called stepson, stepdaughter.
segments.cn: 所以当你新的丈夫或妻子有来自其他婚姻的孩子时，他们被称为继子、继女。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it's the same thing as if my mother got divorced and she remarried, she has a new husband.
segments.cn: 所以这就像我母亲离婚后再婚，她有一个新丈夫。

segments.en: That man would be my stepfather.
segments.cn: 那个男人将是我的继父。

segments.en: Alright, so these are all family members.
segments.cn: 好的，这些都是家庭成员。

segments.en: When you hear the word step, family members that we have because of divorce.
segments.cn: 当你听到“继”这个词时，指的是因为离婚而形成的家庭成员。

segments.en: So stepson, stepdaughter, stepfather, stepmother.
segments.cn: 所以继子、继女、继父、继母。

segments.en: And now, again, related to the whole divorce thing, the person that you get divorced to is called an ex-wife or an ex-husband.
segments.cn: 现在，再次与离婚相关，你离婚的那个人被称为前妻或前夫。

segments.en: Alright, so ex, like ex-girlfriend or ex-boyfriend means previous.
segments.cn: 好的，所以“前”，像前女友或前男友，意味着以前的。

segments.en: So my ex-wife is someone I was married to before, or in the case of a woman, my ex-husband was someone I was married to before, but we got divorced, so we're not married now.
segments.cn: 所以我的前妻是我之前结婚的人，或者在女性的情况下，我的前夫是我之前结婚的人，但我们离婚了，所以我们现在不再结婚。

segments.en: That's exactly it.

segments.en: So it only applies to husband and wife, right?

segments.cn: 你不会说我的前孩子或我的前岳母。

segments.en: Well, because your children are always your children.
segments.cn: 嗯，因为你的孩子永远是你的孩子。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: If you talk about your ex-wife's parents, you just say my ex-wife's father or my ex-wife's mother because there's no more in-law, there's no law, you're not married.
segments.cn: 如果你谈论你前妻的父母，你只需说我前妻的父亲或我前妻的母亲，因为没有更多的姻亲，没有法律关系，你们不再结婚。

segments.en: Right, okay.
segments.cn: 对，好的。

segments.en: And lastly, now we have an uncle, but just not any uncle, we have our great-uncle.
segments.cn: 最后，我们有一个叔叔，但不是任何叔叔，而是我们的外曾叔。

segments.en: Great-uncle, so they actually explain this in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 外曾叔，所以他们在对话中实际上解释了这一点。

segments.en: They say, he is my grandmother's brother.

segments.en: But my great-uncle is one of my grandparents' brothers.

segments.en: So my grandmother's brother or my grandfather's brother.

segments.en: In English, we don't distinguish, we don't say a different word for grandmother's brother or grandfather's brother.
segments.cn: 在英语中，我们不区分，我们不为祖母的兄弟或祖父的兄弟说不同的词。

segments.en: Right, right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，没错。

segments.en: So your great-uncle could be either your grandmother's brother or your grandfather's brother.

segments.en: And now the prefix great can also be applied, for example, to grandparents.

segments.en: So you can say my great-grandfather.

segments.en: That's right.

segments.en: So we're talking about generations.

segments.cn: 我稍后会解释。

segments.en: Let's go.
segments.cn: 我们走吧。

segments.en: So speaking of extended family members, what else can we mention?
segments.cn: 所以说到大家庭成员，我们还可以提到什么？

segments.en: We have a step family, your stepson, your stepdaughter.
segments.cn: 我们有继家人，你的继子，你的继女。

segments.en: What about if you have an adopted child?
segments.cn: 如果你有一个收养的孩子呢？

segments.en: Would you say, would you differentiate it?
segments.cn: 你会说，你会区分吗？

segments.en: Some people do, some people don't.
segments.cn: 有些人会，有些人不会。

segments.en: Most people just say, this is my son, this is my daughter.
segments.cn: 大多数人只是说，这是我的儿子，这是我的女儿。

segments.en: But I would like to add that with stepson, stepdaughter, it's not just divorce that we have this.
segments.cn: 但我想补充的是，继子、继女，不仅仅是离婚才有这种情况。

segments.en: Also, if the parent, maybe the mother dies, and the father has a new wife, then the new wife can say, this is my stepson, this is my stepdaughter.
segments.cn: 如果父母，可能母亲去世，父亲有了新妻子，那么新妻子可以说，这是我的继子，这是我的继女。

segments.en: So there are two possibilities.
segments.cn: 所以有两种可能性。

segments.en: One is death and one is remarriage because of divorce.
segments.cn: 一种是死亡，另一种是因离婚而再婚。

segments.en: But as far as adopted, no, usually just say my son and my daughter.
segments.cn: 但就收养而言，通常只是说我的儿子和女儿。

segments.en: But I can tell you this.
segments.cn: 但我可以告诉你这一点。

segments.en: If my father and my mother divorce, my father has a new wife, and together they have a baby.
segments.cn: 如果我父亲和我母亲离婚，我父亲有了新妻子，他们一起有了一个孩子。

segments.en: The baby, boy or girl, is my half-brother or half-sister because we share one parent, my father.
segments.cn: 这个孩子，无论是男孩还是女孩，都是我的异父兄弟或异母姐妹，因为我们共享一个父母，我的父亲。

segments.en: Right, this is very interesting.
segments.cn: 对，这非常有趣。

segments.en: So if you do have a brother or sister that is not from your same mother or father, but just one parent, then yeah, it's called a half-brother or sister.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有一个兄弟或姐妹，不是来自同一个父母，而是只有一个父母，那么是的，称为异父兄弟或异母姐妹。

segments.en: Half, remember this, half because half of their parents are the same as your parents, maybe one father or mother.
segments.cn: 半，记住这一点，半是因为他们的父母中有一半和你的父母相同，可能是一个父亲或母亲。

segments.en: But with stepbrothers and stepsisters, the only reason you're related is because of marriage, not because of blood.
segments.cn: 但对于继兄弟和继姐妹，你们之间的关系仅仅是因为婚姻，而不是血缘关系。

segments.en: We didn't mention that you could have a stepbrother.
segments.cn: 我们没有提到你可以有一个继兄弟。

segments.en: So it's your brother, but he's legally your brother, but he's not related to your father or anyone in your family.
segments.cn: 所以他是你的兄弟，但他在法律上是你的兄弟，但他和你的父亲或你家里的任何人没有关系。

segments.en: That's right, that's right.
segments.cn: 没错，没错。

segments.en: So maybe you have many stepbrothers.
segments.cn: 所以你可能有很多继兄弟。

segments.en: You could have a stepbrother and a half-brother.
segments.cn: 你可以有一个继兄弟和一个异母兄弟。

segments.en: So there are lots of different combinations because of many different reasons.
segments.cn: 所以因为很多不同的原因，有很多不同的组合。
